Name: Admiral Scheer
Fate: Capsized in harbor by British air attack on 9 April 1945, partially scrapped and buried
Displacement:
Design:

13,660 t (13,440 long tons)

Full load:

15,180 long tons (15,420 t)
Propulsion:
Eight MAN diesel engines
Two propellers
Range: 9,100 nmi (16,900 km; 10,500 mi) at 20 knots (37 km/h; 23 mph)
Complement:
As built:

33 officers
586 enlisted

After 1935:

30 officers
921–1,040 enlisted
Armament:
As built:

6 × 28 cm (11 in) in triple turrets
8 × 15 cm (5.9 in) in single turrets
8 × 53.3 cm (21.0 in) torpedo tubes
Armor:
main turrets: 140 mm (5.5 in)
belt:             80 mm (3.1 in)
deck:             45 mm (1.8 in)
